definition:
From the most general -categorical- point of view, an embedding between
two objects $A,B$ in a category $\cal{C}$ is a $\cal{C}$-morphism
$f\colon A\to B$ which is injective. So, for example, the adjectives
topological, algebraic or geometrical should be used, respectively, when
we talk of embeddings between topological spaces, algebraic structures
or geometries.
